blogs.title: Why is waterproofing necessary for your house?
blogs.author: Anirudh Maheshwari
blogs.description: Imagine you come home after a long day to find a leaky roof dripping on your favorite rug, or worse, mold creeping up the walls in your basement. Not exactly the picture of a relaxing haven, is it? This is where waterproofing comes in - a crucial step, often overlooked, that protects your house from the damaging effects of water. Waterproofing isn't just about preventing leaks; it's a comprehensive shield that safeguards your entire home, from the foundation to the roof. It's like putting on a raincoat for your house! This is why we consider waterproofing an investment and not an expense.

content.text: Now, let’s dive into why this investment is worth making for your house:

items.listData: The foundation is the backbone of your house. Water seepage can weaken it over time, leading to cracks and structural instability.

Water intrusion is one of the leading causes of structural damage to homes. Water seeping into the walls, roof, or foundation can cause the building components' structural integrity to deteriorate. Over time, this can lead to cracks, shifts, and even collapse in severe cases. Waterproofing acts as a barrier, preventing water from penetrating these critical areas and ensuring the longevity of your home’s structure.

A stitch in time saves nine!  Waterproofing can prevent minor leaks from turning into major problems.  Think of it as preventative maintenance for your house.  You'll save money in the long run by avoiding costly repairs caused by water damage.

Damp and moldy environments are breeding grounds for allergens and irritants. Proper waterproofing helps control moisture levels, creating a healthier living space for you and your family. The allergens can trigger respiratory problems and allergies. Waterproofing helps control moisture levels, promoting a healthier indoor environment for you and your family.

items.listHead: Increases the Lifespan of Your House -
items.listData: Consistent exposure to water weakens building materials. Waterproofing slows down this process, extending the lifespan of your house and protecting your investment.
Leaking walls and peeling paint don't exactly add to your home's beauty.  Waterproofing helps prevent these issues, keeping your house looking its best.
Knowing your house is protected from water damage gives you peace of mind. You can relax and enjoy your home without worrying about leaks or structural issues.
Knowing your house is protected from water damage gives you peace of mind. You can relax and enjoy your home without worrying about leaks or structural issues.

content.text: Waterproofing your house isn't just about keeping the rain out; it's about protecting your investment, creating a healthy living space, and ensuring your home stays comfortable and beautiful for years to come. So, don't wait for water damage to strike - take action today and make waterproofing a priority!!

blogs.title: Penetrative Vs Coating-Based Waterproofing: Which Is Right For Your Home?
blogs.author: Anirudh Maheshwari
blogs.description: Waterproofing is an essential aspect of protecting your home from water damage, ensuring its longevity, and maintaining a healthy living environment. There are two main types of waterproofing techniques: penetrative waterproofing and coating-based waterproofing. Let's understand both types of waterproofing and which one is best for your home.

content.text: Penetrative waterproofing acts like an invisible bodyguard for your walls and structure. It soaks deep into the cracks of surfaces like concrete and masonry and makes the surface water-repellent.

Coating waterproofing forms a visible layer on the surface, acting like a raincoat for your structure. These waterproof barriers are applied as a liquid or sheet material, forming a physical barrier against water intrusion.
Choosing The Right Waterproofing For Your Home
Both penetrative and coating-based waterproofing have their own pros and cons, so before starting the waterproofing, one should comprehensively study them.

items.listData: Seeps deep into the substrate and becomes part of it, creating a long-lasting barrier.
Applied chemical doesn't change the physical appearance or beauty of the surface.
Allows the moisture within the surface to escape and prevents paint and plaster peel off due to trapped moisture.
Since it works from within the material, it is less susceptible to wear and tear compared to surface coatings. The internal barrier remains effective over time, reducing the need for reapplication.
Limited effectiveness on highly cracked surfaces.
Not suitable for all surfaces (i.e., wood, metal, etc.)
Creates a robust physical barrier for water and moisture.
The coating is flexible and allows slight movement and expansion without any damage.
White coatings can also enhance the aesthetic look of the structure.
Coatings can bridge small cracks, offering additional protection.
If an area is prone to water or harsh environmental conditions then coating-based waterproofing is preferable. For structures with internal cracks, we can go for penetrative waterproofing.
There is a visible layer and that can affect the appearance of the building.
May need periodic inspection and repairs, especially on exposed areas.

content.text: Now, to decide which waterproofing is best for your house one has to consider some factors such as:

items.listData: If an area is prone to water or harsh environmental conditions then coating-based waterproofing is preferable. For structures with internal cracks, we can go for penetrative waterproofing.
Penetrative waterproofing is preferred where there is less requirement for maintenance, whereas coating-based waterproofing requires comparatively more maintenance.
Cost plays a major role in deciding which waterproofing is suitable for one's house.
In most of the cases, it is best to use both types of waterproofing for comprehensive protection and to ensure maximum effectiveness.

content.text: To know more about how can you make your home completely waterproof read - Steps to make your home completely waterproof.

blogs.title: Steps to make your home completely waterproof
blogs.author: Anirudh Maheshwari
blogs.description: Water can be one of the most dangerous enemies of your house. Water seeps into the small micro-cracks in your house and starts deteriorating the wood, concrete, and metal of your structure. Damp areas in a building promote the growth of fungi and algae, which in turn results in health issues for the members of the house. Water dampness damages the interior of the building, like paint, posters, etc., which causes heavy financial losses to the owner of the building. Last but not least, water leakage can cause electrical short circuits, which can even cause loss of life.

content.text: Now, we have seen how water can damage your house let's see how can we make your house completely waterproof so that there is no way water can damage it. We will start by seeing what damage water can cause your house, where is waterproofing required in it and which treatment is best suited for it.

Water mainly causes problems like seepage and leakage in your home. Seepage refers to the slow escape of a liquid through porous material or small holes. It can result in paint peel-off, rebar corrosion and fungal growth. Whereas leakage refers to the escape of liquid through a hole or crack which can range from nanometer to milimeter.

We, at Maheshwari Enterprises, provide two types of waterproofing treatment namely -penetrative waterproofing and coating-based waterproofing. Combined use of both of them provide comprehensive solution to all your waterproofing needs. Waterproofing chemicals are from Zydex Industries Pvt. Ltd(A specialty chemicals company with the purpose of innovating diverse set of chemical technologies for the Textile, Agriculture, Pavement and Construction Industries).

Seepage can be prevented using penetrative waterproofing treatment (Zycosil+ and Zycoprime+), but leakage has to be treated using coating-based waterproofing (Elastobar/Elastostretch/Elastomax). It is best to avoid these problems beforehand and thus waterproofing treatments give best results when applied during new construction.
We will start by discussing stages of your house where waterproofing is required and which treatment should be applied.

items.listData: Penetrative waterproofing in the foundation helps to stop the dampness from beneath the building. We apply penetrative waterproofing through spray machine so that maximum area is covered in an even way. The horizontal surface and the walls of the foundation must be covered and chemical must be sprayed till the saturation is reached.

Penetrative waterproofing at DPC level is highly effective in preventing rising dampness. Rising dampness is often the main reason for paint and plaster peel off at ground level. The application method is same as described in the previous step.

To prevent the paint to be damaged partition walls must also be treated with penetrative waterproofing. Our penetrative waterproofing is breathable, which is why it lets the moisture in wall escape without damaging the paint and plaster.

Waterproofing additives when added to the concrete enhances its waterproofing properties, improves durability & longevity and also prevents corrosion of TMT bars. Therefore, with our waterproofing additives you not only make your RCC waterproof but also enhances its strength.

In an area which is more prone to water for a long time both penetrative waterproofing and coating-based waterproofing must be applied, for there is more chance of leakage along with seepage. Our coating-based waterproofing is water resistant, highly stretchable (up to 250%), has high bonding strength and also has crack bridging properties. Penetrative waterproofing and coating-based waterproofing when applied with fiber mesh gives full proof protection from seepage and leakage in your bathrooms.

Since water can be retained on terrace in rainy season it is best preferred to apply both penetrative and coating-based waterproofing on it. We at Maheshwari Enterprises provide with white membrane coating (Zydex Elastomax) with a service life of up to 10 years. Not only does it waterproof your terrace but also reduces the room temperature by 5-10%. Also, after applying it you need not put any paint, tiles or china-mozek (tukdi), which in turn reduces your overall cost of waterproofing.

content.text: With waterproofing treatment at above stages, you can get your home completely waterproof and safe from water for an average life of 20-30 years.

It is often said that “prevention is better than cure” and it applies very much on waterproofing your home too. Water seepage and leakage can cause damages much larger than the initial cost of waterproofing your home.
